z_score_risk_thresholds.low: 3-10: Moderately unusual activity that deviates from normal baseline patterns
z_score_risk_thresholds.medium: 10-20: Highly unusual activity requiring investigation - represents behavior 10+ standard deviations from normal
z_score_risk_thresholds.high: 20-50: Extremely rare events that occur less than 0.01% of the time in normal operations
z_score_risk_thresholds.critical: >50: Unprecedented behavior never seen in baseline - immediate threat response required

baseline_explanation.normal_logcount_range: 75000-76500 authentication events per day for typical users
baseline_explanation.normal_host_increment: 5-7 unique host connections per user session
baseline_explanation.normal_ip_increment: 2-3 source IP addresses per authentication sequence
baseline_explanation.normal_process_increment: 2-16 process spawns depending on user privilege level

critical_anomalies.detailed_explanation: This computer account generated 4,563,430 authentication events in a single session - 60x higher than the baseline of ~76,000 daily events. The z-score of 30.2 means this volume is 30 standard deviations above normal, occurring with probability < 10^-200. Normal computer accounts authenticate 75-76k times daily; this account's 4.5M authentications represent automated or scripted behavior.
threat_indicators: Potential credential stuffing or brute force attack
Malicious scheduled task or service generating excessive authentications
Possible lateral movement tool attempting multiple authentication vectors
recommended_actions: IMMEDIATE: Disable TBQPF45YEK2$ account pending investigation
Analyze authentication source IPs (10.7.56.175) for compromise indicators
Review STBVDRADC01 domain controller logs for suspicious processes
Check for unauthorized scheduled tasks or services on source system
Correlate with network monitoring for data exfiltration attempts
critical_anomalies.statistical_context: This represents the 99.999th percentile of authentication volume - never observed in normal operations

critical_anomalies.detailed_explanation: Logout event count of 4,535,827 is 29.4 standard deviations above normal. This matches the excessive login pattern, indicating systematic logout behavior following mass authentication attempts. The logout-to-login ratio suggests automated tooling cycling through authentication attempts.
threat_indicators: Coordinated attack campaign using TBQPF45YEK2$ as pivot account
Password spraying or credential validation operations
recommended_actions: IMMEDIATE: Isolate STBVDRADC01 domain controller
Forensic imaging of TBQPF45YEK2$ account activity logs
Network traffic analysis for C2 communications
Hunt for similar patterns on other domain controllers
critical_anomalies.statistical_context: Probability of occurrence in normal operations: < 10^-180

critical_anomalies.detailed_explanation: ANONYMOUS LOGON account accessed from 47 unique IP addresses in short timeframe - 75.9 standard deviations above normal. Anonymous logons should be extremely rare and typically only occur during specific system operations. The high IP increment (47 vs normal 2-3) suggests scanning or reconnaissance activity across network ranges.
threat_indicators: Internal network scanning from compromised host
Privilege escalation attempt via anonymous access
recommended_actions: IMMEDIATE: Block source IP 10.7.56.170 at firewall
Disable anonymous logon capabilities on STBVADC04
Audit all systems that accepted anonymous authentication
Review network ACLs and anonymous access policies
Hunt for lateral movement from 10.7.56.170 source
critical_anomalies.statistical_context: This is the highest anomaly score observed - represents completely unprecedented behavior

critical_anomalies.detailed_explanation: LOCAL SERVICE account spawned WmiPrvSE.exe process 1,860 times with process increment z-score of 41.2. WmiPrvSE.exe is the WMI Provider Service, typically spawned 2-5 times during normal operations. 1,860 process spawns indicates potential WMI exploitation for lateral movement, persistence, or reconnaissance.
threat_indicators: PowerShell Empire or similar framework usage
recommended_actions: Analyze WMI event logs (Microsoft-Windows-WMI-Activity/Operational)
Review WMI queries and process execution chains
Hunt for PowerShell or other scripting engine usage
Check for suspicious WMI subscriptions or permanent event consumers
Isolate STBVADC05 pending investigation
critical_anomalies.statistical_context: WMI process spawning 41 standard deviations above normal - indicates systematic exploitation

critical_anomalies.detailed_explanation: taskhostw.exe process spawned 1,099 times by LOCAL SERVICE - 41.1 standard deviations above baseline. taskhostw.exe hosts scheduled tasks and should spawn infrequently. Mass spawning suggests scheduled task abuse for persistence, privilege escalation, or payload execution.
recommended_actions: Audit all scheduled tasks on STBVDRADC01
Review task scheduler logs for suspicious entries
Check for recently created or modified scheduled tasks
Analyze taskhostw.exe child processes and command lines
Hunt for persistence mechanisms across domain controllers
critical_anomalies.statistical_context: Task hosting behavior 41 standard deviations above normal indicates systematic abuse

attack_patterns_identified.description: Computer account TBQPF45YEK2$ conducting massive authentication operations (4M+ events) from single IP 10.7.56.175
ANONYMOUS LOGON account accessed from 47 unique IPs indicating network enumeration
LOCAL SERVICE accounts spawning excessive WMI and task scheduler processes across multiple hosts
indicators: Process spawning 41+ standard deviations above normal

investigation_priorities.rationale: Highest volume anomalies (30+ z-scores) indicating potential APT lateral movement
immediate_actions: Disable account and isolate affected systems

investigation_priorities.rationale: Extreme network reconnaissance activity (75.9 z-score) suggests active scanning
immediate_actions: Block source networks and disable anonymous access
Hunt for lateral movement from scanning sources

investigation_priorities.rationale: Critical process anomalies indicating persistence mechanisms
immediate_actions: Audit WMI subscriptions and scheduled tasks

threat_assessment.rationale: Multiple 20+ z-score anomalies across different attack vectors indicate coordinated threat activity
threat_assessment.timeline: Active compromise ongoing - immediate response required

actions: Block IP 10.7.56.175 at perimeter and internal firewalls
Isolate STBVDRADC01, STBVADC04, STBVADC05 from network
Enable enhanced WMI and scheduled task logging
Forensic imaging of affected domain controllers
Hunt for similar anomaly patterns on other systems
Review and revoke suspicious Kerberos tickets
Audit all computer and service accounts for compromise
Deploy additional monitoring on authentication systems
Implement behavioral analytics for authentication patterns
Review and update anonymous access policies
Enhance monitoring of WMI and scheduled task activities
Conduct threat hunting across entire environment
Update incident response procedures based on lessons learned

metrics: Unique IP count per authentication session (alert > 10)
Anonymous logon attempts (alert on any occurrence)
Computer account authentication patterns (alert on volume spikes)
Scheduled task creation and modification events
Source IP diversity per authentication session
